intro: Jefea gnaphalioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, blooming in the spring. Jefea gnaphalioides is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
